title: Average rate of change
prompt:
A function is shown in the graph. What is the average
rate of change of the function from x = 5 to x = 9?
hint: Think about any price "per" item, and then what operation you would use to find what 5 of those items cost.
feedback:
<math>
 <mtable columnalign='left'>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mtext>First, find the coordinates of the points on the graph:</mtext>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mtext>when </mtext><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>,</mo><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>→</mo><mtext> (5, 3)</mtext>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mtext>when </mtext><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>9</mn><mo>,</mo><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>→</mo><mtext> (9, 8)</mtext>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mrow></mrow>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mtext>The average rate of change is the slope of the line through</mtext>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mtext>these points:</mtext>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mrow></mrow>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mtext>ave</mtext><mtext>. rate of change</mtext><mo>=</mo><mfrac>
     <mrow>
      <mn>8</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow>
     <mrow>
      <mn>9</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow>
    </mfrac>
    <mo>=</mo><mfrac>
     <mn>5</mn>
     <mn>4</mn>
    </mfrac>
    <mo>=</mo><mn>1.25</mn>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
 </mtable>
 
</math>
